title: Parimal Steel Engineers marketing site + owner-editable Admin CMS (frontend)

requirements.summary: Build a public English marketing website with navigable sections/pages: Home, Services, Materials, Clients, About, Contact, using provided business details and placeholders where needed.
acceptanceCriteria: Site has navigable sections/pages for Home, Services, Materials, Clients, About, Contact

Services section includes the provided service list (cabin structure, machinery structure, hand railing, benches, roof sheds, godown, boundary wall, changing room structure, gazebo, tower parking platform, canopy)
Materials section explicitly mentions mild steel and stainless steel
Clients section lists: Techno Glaze, Shree Krishna Group, Raheja, Hiranandani, Kalpatru
Contact section displays “Andheri East, Mumbai” and “Owner: Hiten Parimal Makwana” plus editable placeholders for phone/email (since none were provided)

file_operations.description: Create the app shell and routing for public pages/sections (Home, Services, Materials, Clients, About, Contact) and wire navigation to them.
Ensure the new App component is used as the application root and routing is correctly mounted.
Implement the public marketing UI layout and sections, rendering content from the backend content read capability (getContent) and including the required business details and placeholders.
Create a responsive header with logo/brand area and navigation links to the required pages/sections.
Create composable section components for Home, Services, Materials, Clients, About, Contact to keep the public page structured and maintainable.
Add a React Query hook to fetch and cache public website content via the backend actor (getContent) for use across the public sections.

requirements.summary: Apply black + dark yellow + metallic/industrial styling consistently across the UI with readable contrast.
acceptanceCriteria: Primary background is black/dark tones with dark yellow used consistently for emphasis (CTAs, highlights, headings or borders)
UI includes a metallic/industrial visual treatment (e.g., brushed-metal style gradients/textures and subtle sheen) without reducing readability
Contrast meets basic readability standards for text on dark backgrounds

file_operations.description: Define global theme variables and base styles for the black/dark background, dark yellow accents, and metallic/industrial look while maintaining readable contrast.
Extend Tailwind theme tokens to support the brand palette (dark background, dark yellow accents) and reusable metallic/industrial surface styling.
Create a reusable wrapper component for metallic/industrial surface treatment to keep styling consistent across sections.

requirements.summary: Implement an owner-only Admin CMS area with sign-in, edit forms, and save/publish actions for all editable site content and projects, reflecting changes on public pages after reload.
acceptanceCriteria: Admin area exists and is accessible from the UI (e.g., /admin)
Editing forms cover: hero text, about/company text, services list items, materials text, clients list items, and contact fields
Changes saved in Admin are reflected on the public pages after reload
Edits persist across canister upgrades (stable storage)

file_operations.description: Create the /admin page that provides sign-in controls, loads current content for editing, and allows saving updates back to the backend.

Implement edit forms for hero headline/subheadline, company/about description, materials text, services list, clients list, and contact details; include save/publish action that calls the backend update capability (updateContent).

Implement Admin UI for managing Portfolio/Projects entries (add/edit/remove), including optional image support; uses backend project write capabilities and integrates placeholder UI when images are not provided.
Add hooks/mutations for admin-managed content editing: fetch current content (getContent) and save updates (updateContent), with cache invalidation so public pages reflect changes after reload.
Add hooks for reading projects (getProjects) and admin mutations for add/update/delete (addProject/updateProject/deleteProject), including handling of optional images.
Wire an Admin link/button into the public UI navigation to make the Admin area discoverable (e.g., link to /admin).
Register and wire the /admin route to the Admin page so it is navigable.

requirements.summary: Secure editing via Internet Identity sign-in and admin authorization checks, showing clear signed-in and access-denied states.
acceptanceCriteria: Unauthenticated users cannot access write endpoints; backend rejects unauthorized updates
Authenticated non-admin principals cannot update content
Admin principal(s) can update content successfully
Frontend shows a clear sign-in state and access-denied state for non-admin users

file_operations.description: Create a login/logout button using the Internet Identity hook and clear cached queries on logout. Use the authorization component guidance for auth flow; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Add a small authz helper hook that queries the backend for caller role/admin status (e.g., isCallerAdmin/getCallerUserRole) to guard Admin UI. Use the authorization component guidance; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Create a clear access-denied screen/state to show when a signed-in user is not an admin.

Implement first-login profile setup (ask for name, save via saveCallerUserProfile, avoid modal flash). Use the authorization component guidance; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Require Internet Identity sign-in for Admin, display sign-in state, block editing UI unless admin, and handle backend authorization failures with user-friendly messaging. Use the authorization component guidance; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add a public Portfolio/Projects section and Admin management UI for project entries (title, description, optional images) with complete placeholder treatment when images are absent.
acceptanceCriteria: Public site includes a Portfolio/Projects section
Admin can add/edit/remove project entries with title and description
If images are not provided, the UI still looks complete and uses a clean placeholder treatment

file_operations.description: Create a public Portfolio/Projects section that lists projects from the backend (getProjects), supports optional images, and shows polished placeholders when images are missing.
Wire the Portfolio/Projects section into the public site layout so it is visible and navigable.

Add UI for optional project images using ExternalBlob; support adding/removing images and show upload/progress states. Use the blob-storage component capability for image/blob handling; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create a reusable project card component to render title/description and optional image previews using direct URLs when available. Use the blob-storage component capability for rendering blob-hosted images; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Ensure responsive performance-minded UI and basic SEO metadata (title + description) relevant to Parimal Steel Engineers fabrication services in Mumbai.
acceptanceCriteria: Layouts adapt cleanly to mobile and desktop breakpoints
No horizontal overflow on common viewport sizes
Document title and meta description are set and relevant to the business

file_operations.description: Add/update basic SEO metadata including a relevant meta description (fabrication services in Mumbai) and ensure the document title matches the brand.
Ensure the header/nav is responsive (mobile menu behavior) and does not cause horizontal overflow.
Ensure all sections are responsive across breakpoints and avoid horizontal overflow; use performance-minded rendering for lists and images.

requirements.summary: Add generated static brand assets under the public assets directory and reference them in the header/logo area and hero section.
acceptanceCriteria: Generated images exist under frontend/public/assets/generated and are referenced directly by the frontend
Header/logo area and hero section use the generated assets

file_operations.description: Add the generated company logo mark + wordmark asset to the public generated assets directory so the UI can reference it.
Add the generated hero background asset to the public generated assets directory so the UI can reference it.
Add the generated service icons set asset to the public generated assets directory so the UI can reference it.
Wire the generated logo image at frontend/public/assets/generated/pse-logo.dim_512x512.png into the header/brand area.

Wire the generated hero background image at frontend/public/assets/generated/pse-hero-bg.dim_1920x800.png into the Home hero section and reference frontend/public/assets/generated/pse-service-icons.dim_1024x1024.png for service iconography where appropriate.
